refnamediv.refpurpose: Receives data from other processes using the low-level UDP or TCP protocols

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Receives directly using the UDP (sockrecv and sockrecvs) or TCP (strecv) protocol onto a network. The data is not subject to any encoding or special routing. The sockrecvs opcode receives a stereo signal interleaved.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Sipaddr -- a string that is the IP address of the sender in standard 4-octet dotted form.
iport -- the number of the port that is used for the communication.

ilength -- the length of the individual packets in UDP transmission. This number must be sufficiently small to fit a single MTU, which is set to the save value of 1456. In UDP transmissions the sender and receiver needs agree on this value

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: asig, asigl, asigr -- audio data to be received.

refsect1.title: Example
refsect1.para: The example shows a mono signal being received on port 7777 using UDP.

informalexample.programlisting:
sr = 44100 ksmps = 100 nchnls = 1
instr 1 a1 sockrecv 7777, 200 out a1 endin
